I'm having a bit of a rugged individualist reaction to the notion that a project has to "appeal" to the release management crew to make a feature branch, but that's probably the result of the brainwashing of a 1970s and 80s US public school education. So I'll let it go.

That probably doesn't need to be clarified here, as long as it is clear somewhere else.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I'm having a bit of a rugged individualist reaction to the notion
 > that a project has to "appeal" to the release management crew to
 > make a feature branch, but that's probably the result of the
 > brainwashing of a 1970s and 80s US public school education. So I'll
 > let it go.
 > 
 > That probably doesn't need to be clarified here, as long as it is
 > clear somewhere else.

You would be surprised at the number of different ways people have gotten tagging and branching wrong. The validation logic in the releases repo helps a great deal with reducing errors in tagging and branch creation. It's not perfect, but it's easier to use than the similar set of instructions for verifying everything manually.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-03-29 19:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-30 08:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from abandon-tagging to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-03-30 10:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-04-02 19:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-03 23:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 13629, 'date': '2018-04-06 08:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This also came up when Cyborg did the Queens independent release'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-04-06 10:31:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Does relinquishing tagging rights also imply relinquishing artifact publishing rights? Some non-python projects exist or could come along that have a unique artifact building and publishing process that the infra and release teams might not be equipt to handle (I think the puppet team went through this, although I understand they've since worked it out). Are we requiring them to have that sorted out before they can be official?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-06 11:24:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Does relinquishing tagging rights also imply relinquishing artifact
 > publishing rights? Some non-python projects exist or could come
 > along that have a unique artifact building and publishing process
 > that the infra and release teams might not be equipt to handle (I
 > think the puppet team went through this, although I understand
 > they've since worked it out). Are we requiring them to have that
 > sorted out before they can be official?

The only thing they're giving up is the use of direct tagging in favor of using the tag automation. What happens after the tag is applied to a repo is up to them, although I think the release team would want to see at least a job that builds a source tarball.

Teams that aren't far enough along with their work to actually be publishing versions of the software somehow don't seem like good candidates for official projects, although I guess we don't have a hard rule about that today."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-06 11:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-04-06 11:45:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-09 14:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Majority reached on April 6, to be approved on April 10 unless last-minute objections are posted'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-10 07:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Official projects should not keep tagging rights

Release management of official projects is handled by
the Release Management team through the openstack/releases
repository. Set the expectation early on that official
projects will have to drop direct tagging (or branching)
rights in their Gerrit ACLs once they are made official.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/557733
Change-Id: Iade3f85d133892464e4c9f21ce2977ca0dd8930d

commit_message:
Move Logout under User Name Dropdown

This patch cleans up the navigation a bit and tucks the logout
action under a new dropdown that shows the username. This will
help reduce any errant logouts and follow the PatternFly logout
pattern. This change fixes one bug and partially fixes another.

Change-Id: I525af00f4c121fcae7f186d1a4d61ade8d8b33f6
Closes-Bug: #1727501
Partial-Bug: #1691113

I thought this looked familiar to me. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443604/. Would one of you (John, Shiv)? take a look and see if there is anything in the other one that we could carry forward too? 443604 seems more detailed but maybe this particular fix is good enough?'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Oh... partprobe is called more than once. Should we use the retry for all of them?'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Getting labelled partitions is early on in the process and where data the device may still be locked as we could be coming off from a locked operation that is not completed yet to the actual media. I feel like only once is fine since it is where we would encounter locking and stale data after changes to the underlying disk.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-04-10 07:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Ruby, This fix looks good enough to me. Capturing the new config option in the commit message is a miss from our side.'}]

commit_message:
Add retry attempts for the partprobe command

The partprobe command may fail because the device is busy some
times. Add retry attempts to resolve this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1756760
Change-Id: Ic888e7b6c93e83511a76bf8000619531b1eec9e1

files into horizon enabled dashboards.

Change-Id: Ic6c010b343757e3172b92386cda386524f749eeb
Closes-Bug: #1761392

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 14:49:17.000000000', 'message': 'Make test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full more generic

This patch is making the test test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full more
generic to work with different ML2 drivers.

The test is being changed to set the quotas to the number of existing
ports + 1, instead of having it hardcoded to 1. The reason for that is
because the ML2/OVN driver does create a port to be used by the metadata
service upon creating a new network. That would then already fulfil the
ports quota for that tenant.

This approach was suggested at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129084.html

Closes-Bug: #1761119
Change-Id: I86fe55eb48b9964b33d4b5174a248676129abfb1
'}]
commit_message:
Make test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full more generic

This patch is making the test test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full more
generic to work with different ML2 drivers.

The test is being changed to set the quotas to the number of existing
ports + 1, instead of having it hardcoded to 1. The reason for that is
because the ML2/OVN driver does create a port to be used by the metadata
service upon creating a new network. That would then already fulfil the
ports quota for that tenant.

This approach was suggested at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129084.html

Closes-Bug: #1761119
Change-Id: I86fe55eb48b9964b33d4b5174a248676129abfb1

two issues:
1. when we do startswith "aaa" can match "aaab.novalocal" as well. In which the test case will not work as expected. We should look at hostname.split(".")[0] so that we get first part of it and match it.
2. In the error message "msg" we are printing hostname as is whereas we should have changed it to what we are trying to really match.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-03-14 02:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-03-14 02:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix test_host_name_is_same_as_server_name

Some images will add postfix for the hostname, e.g.,
if hostname is "aaa", postfix ".novalocal" may be added
to it, and the hostname will be "aaa.novalocal" then, so
we should ignore the postfix when checking whether hostname
equals self.name.

Change-Id: Ie3d603875c029ca705ee58e0f4e9d11950f509aa
Closes-Bug: #1755398

commit_message:
Enhance the travis hack

unshallowing is now enough for supporting Pull Requests.
Travis also detach the HEAD its branch, resulting in
reno failing when not finding the ref 'master'

Change-Id: Ic03d50f5eef399009d955be13a806c2628f6166a
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>

The -1 is for the equality check in _find_constraint().

The rest is a brain dump'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 13:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 17:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 17:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 21:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 21:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me!

Thanks Doug'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-30 04:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-30 19:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-04-09 03:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-09 14:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:26:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

There is a valid time that'd happen (mainly on stable branckes).

Sometimes we have the following releases available.
1.0; 1.1; 1.2; 1.3
The GR is set to >=1.0;!=1.0
This would make the effective minimum 1.1.  This happens most often on stable branches where we don't bump minimums but only exclude known bad releases."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-09 17:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> There is a valid time that'd happen (mainly on stable branckes).
 > 
 > Sometimes we have the following releases available.
 > 1.0; 1.1; 1.2; 1.3
 > The GR is set to >=1.0;!=1.0
 > This would make the effective minimum 1.1.  This happens most often
 > on stable branches where we don't bump minimums but only exclude
 > known bad releases.

The global minimum is not used for testing local lower constraints.

The *exclusions* from the local requirement specification are compared to the global requirement specification to ensure that the local values are a subset of the global values. The minimum is not included in that set, and those rules are not applied to the local lower constraint.

The local lower constraint is checked against the *local* requirement specification to ensure that those versions match exactly. That implies we always use ">=" to set the minimum, and that we don't do something like in your example where we spell ">" using 2 separate (conflicting) specifiers.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-04-10 07:23:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> There is a valid time that'd happen (mainly on stable branckes).
 > 
 > Sometimes we have the following releases available.
 > 1.0; 1.1; 1.2; 1.3
 > The GR is set to >=1.0;!=1.0

That is not allowed on stable branches.  If we have that then we have a human error."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 20:13:27.000000000', 'message': 'add validation rules for lower constraints

The requirement lower bound and lower-constraints.txt value must
match.

The lower-constraints.txt value must be compatible with the specified
range, including exclusions.

If there is no lower-constraints.txt file the additional tests are
skipped.

If no minimum is specified, the misconfiguration is left to the other
validation logic to catch.

Only files associated with test jobs are checked because other jobs
are not run with the lower constraints list.

Change-Id: Iefe3ef8a89e965537486a1c9a62ab887b4401530
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add validation rules for lower constraints

The requirement lower bound and lower-constraints.txt value must
match.

The lower-constraints.txt value must be compatible with the specified
range, including exclusions.

If there is no lower-constraints.txt file the additional tests are
skipped.

If no minimum is specified, the misconfiguration is left to the other
validation logic to catch.

Only files associated with test jobs are checked because other jobs
are not run with the lower constraints list.

Change-Id: Iefe3ef8a89e965537486a1c9a62ab887b4401530
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: Ied000915f0536b8f147cfafea7d0f26a388bee5f
Depends-On: I3214de424932ce5fadda10d6429dd1fda5d5e6b5

commit_message:
Enable missing support for large objects in Swift

The slo and dlo middlewares are required to enable support for large
objects (> 5GB). Also enabling the copy & versioned_writes middleware,
which enables object copying and versionining.

Change-Id: Iff73833f1d470750862873f70a4a9aaba50bd164

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-18 09:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Quick question:
If a deployer creates a custom driver and wants to add it to Congress, s/he would change setup.cfg correct? Is there some kind of special step/script the deployer would need to run after editing setup.cfg so that Congress knows about the changes?

Nothing is required. After he writes the driver, add the entry point in setup.cfg, installing the code would automatically make it available, service restart is required .'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-12 08:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-12 09:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-16 12:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-19 04:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

ready for review'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-22 22:40:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Looks good to me overall!

One comment: I think we should make sure we can support adding custom drivers in a new config option without changing setup.cfg. Because setup.cfg gets overwritten on upgrades but config files get preserved. We want someone's custom driver configuration to be preserved in an upgrade.

I'm sure stevedore has support for using python code reading config to add additional entry points right?"}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:30:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

@Eric, I'm sure stevedore has support for using python code reading config to add additional entry points right?
stevedore doesn't have support for the same"}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-03-16 03:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Thanks Anusha.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-16 04:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-23 05:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-23 05:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Eric, updated with your review comment. And also, im checking on custom drivers addition too, will raise a separate patch for the same.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-23 11:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2018-03-23 15:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Would loading unnecessary driver have any impact?'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-26 08:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@rajiv, what do you mean by unnecessary driver?'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2018-03-26 13:58:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

may be i misunderstood or i don't have enough understanding. What if there are drivers, not needed for a use case or deployment. If all the drivers are loaded automatically then those unnecessary drivers will also be loaded? is this scenario valid or hypothetical?"}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-27 04:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@rajiv, we are providing option to disable drivers if not needed (check commit message) , so those wont get loaded. And also, invoke_on_load is False initially, so wont be invoked unless respective datasource is created. hope that answers your question'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-03-29 00:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

Thanks Anusha! LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-06 03:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-04-06 04:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Eric, DriverManager is used to load single driver with a given name from the namespace, doesn't satisfy our usecase as you have mentioned before of keeping existing behavior of loading all supported drivers at start instead of loading the same as required."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-06 04:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Ah thanks for the explanation. Now I remember actually reading that last time I reviewed. Then forgot =p'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-09 18:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-04-10 05:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1

Thanks Eric. Merging it as no further comments'}]

commit_message:
Loads all available drivers by default

This commit loads all datasources drivers by default without the need
of config option. The config option 'drivers' would be deprecated as it
is required to update manually on newly supported drivers for each release
and also error prone.

To disable any of the drivers, can be disabled using the config option
'disabled_drivers'

For example,
disabled_drivers = plexxi, murano

TODO: Support disabled_drivers option to disable the datasource drivers

Partially-Implements blueprint enable-drivers-by-default
Change-Id: I5f9878d07c2e1487f8f14f7cd1948560327d8083

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

This fine, but I'd prefer something like Nova's Feature Support Matrix [1]. Here's how it's generated [2]. Our version would be a bit simpler I guess.

The issue is we'll always forget to update this before the release. I wonder if there's a way to automate this altogether? Probably not, because we don't have a way to fetch K8s releases when building the docs

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/support-matrix.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/search?utf8=&q=Feature+Support+Matrix"}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-04-08 11:59:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

One question inside and please fix Dani's comment"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-09 07:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This fine, but I'd prefer something like Nova's Feature Support
 > Matrix [1]. Here's how it's generated [2]. 

I would rather use that format for the features (like ports pool, multi-pools, cni-daemon, ...) and its driver support, but not for the releases. That said, no strong opinion.

> Our version would be a
 > bit simpler I guess.
 > 
 > The issue is we'll always forget to update this before the release.
 > I wonder if there's a way to automate this altogether? Probably
 > not, because we don't have a way to fetch K8s releases when
 > building the docs
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/support-matrix.html
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/search?utf8=&q=Feature+Support+Matrix"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-09 07:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-04-09 07:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-04-10 06:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add documentation about supported kubernetes versions

This patch adds a documentation placeholder to keep track of the
supported/tested version of kubernetes at the different
kuryr-kubernetes releases.

Change-Id: I53c6ae31cdd380876328ad357afc4c8938c7e5a0
Closes-Bug: 1752285

commit_message:
Remove the disable_upgrade_deployment flag validation

This flag is no longer used or expected in the roles_data so
we should remove the validation which is now confusing at best.

Change-Id: I4227f82168271089ae32cbb1f318d4a84e278cc7
Depends-On: Ib340376ee80ea42a732a51d0c195b048ca0440ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 20:28:53.000000000', 'message': "Remove non-conditional worker count configuration

Backport https://review.openstack.org/#/c/481587/ didn't remove the
existing lines that unconditionally set the worker counts. This results
in neutron effectively using 'processorcount' for worker counts.

Change-Id: Ic75049ad2b8cde7325dd68a89e25e7770fad00f0
Closes-Bug: #1745016
"}]
commit_message:
Remove non-conditional worker count configuration

Backport https://review.openstack.org/#/c/481587/ didn't remove the
existing lines that unconditionally set the worker counts. This results
in neutron effectively using 'processorcount' for worker counts.

Change-Id: Ic75049ad2b8cde7325dd68a89e25e7770fad00f0
Closes-Bug: #1745016

commit_message:
VNX: fix performance in create/delete_volume

When in high concurrency, it is helpful to avoid commands or use
commands with "-np" option, in this patch, the following changes are
made:

* use '-np' when creating new lun.
* do not query if it's an snap-copy volume.
* do not issue unnecessary 'snap -destroy' when deleting volume.

Change-Id: I5dbeca00bfbd19133805556cdcc5214d069e3b28

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-05 19:38:14.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up doc configuration

Remove some stale settings and get rid of setting version and
release. Those settings are now taken care of by openstackdocstheme
and do not need to be explicitly set, and since docs jobs no
longer install the project in order to generate docs, we are not
able to load those values from the python modules anyway.

Change-Id: I1a9a48538ca5c5e22e02f34c837e8fc783aeb2e9
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up doc configuration

Remove some stale settings and get rid of setting version and
release. Those settings are now taken care of by openstackdocstheme
and do not need to be explicitly set, and since docs jobs no
longer install the project in order to generate docs, we are not
able to load those values from the python modules anyway.

Change-Id: I1a9a48538ca5c5e22e02f34c837e8fc783aeb2e9

commit_message:
Move testing info higher in contrib docs

This moves the Testing section to be second in the TOC after
setting up the development environment so the high level info
people need is up front before the information that digs into
more specific details.

Change-Id: Ieeafc483a11fc30139e1969cf2607c55cf4e4802

commit_message:
Use sphinxcontrib.apidoc for module docs

Now that sphinxcontrib.apidoc is available, we should get rid of
the custom code we have for generating this information ourselves.
This also cleans up some really stale docs that are no longer
needed.

Change-Id: Iaa9fecc2478326b45b67a2cfd98de5f93f537efe

commit_message:
Fix debian-stretch-arm64 on nl03.o.o

We had a typo in our nodepool configuration, fix that.

Also fix sort ordering for linaro.

Change-Id: Ifceb014b0fd7ce26b809366c441cfd4c91fff091
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert remaining multinode jobs to config-download

As we move towards making config-download the default, this converts the
remaining multinode jobs that run against master changes to use
config-download.

Once it's the default, we can come back and update these configs to not
have to explicitly use --config-download.

Change-Id: I459bf28a9d35a0f6134f6ed13ccdd48823240bbb
implements: blueprint config-download-default

commit_message:
Add spacing for readability

Add blank lines between the Ansible tasks and plays in the stack
outputs. This is an improvement in readability for the user.

Change-Id: I52ebd9081cacf213ac29f1d24e73db6ea5cfe33f

commit_message:
Support deploy_steps_tasks step 0

These tasks would run before any individual server deployments. A
specific use case is for rebooting dpdk/nfv nodes before applying
NetworkDeployment, etc.

Change-Id: I9e410def25184e635568db67149264ac89c999ed

commit_message:
Improve messages on node state transitions

First, the state is called 'manageable', not 'managed'. Second,
the current messages do not provide enough context to be valuable.
This change modifies them to include nodes count and uses more
precise wording.

Change-Id: Ia1226123271408e959d7aa2049140c06f7ba5e87
(cherry picked from commit 9f2980d7a269f457e37924e55580ac7399afb54e)

[{'created': '2018-04-05 20:28:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add firewall rule to octavia health mgmt iface

The Octavia amphora agent periodically sends heartbeat packets to the
Octavia health manager service which listens on udp/5555. A firewall
rule needs to be added to allow such traffic on interface
OctaviaMgmtPortDevName.

Change-Id: If6c98c18dfe02d5ab8af1806fed401ab945ed18a
(cherry picked from commit 15c53698bcae520ded5d7d8a79351966643661b4)
'}]
commit_message:
Add firewall rule to octavia health mgmt iface

The Octavia amphora agent periodically sends heartbeat packets to the
Octavia health manager service which listens on udp/5555. A firewall
rule needs to be added to allow such traffic on interface
OctaviaMgmtPortDevName.

Change-Id: If6c98c18dfe02d5ab8af1806fed401ab945ed18a

commit_message:
Changing the description of NeutronSriovNumVFs parameter

The NeutronSriovNumVFs parameter could have now another option (mode)
The mode could be legacy as a default value or switchdev in case of
enabling ovs hardware offload


Change-Id: Ic1a70feea4409368f6199ed0ae3729d3127077bd

commit_message:
Switched to pyroute2.config.asyncio.asyncio_config

To monkey patch socket module for pyroute2, we call eventlet_config.
In recent releases of the library, this becomes deprecated. Instead, we
should now use asyncio_config() to patch stdlib.

When building module index for tacker docs, it creates a warning,
treated as error: Please use pyroute2.config.asyncio.asyncio_config

Closes-Bug: #1761925
Change-Id: I8f21cfa02e1201f4968ec0ce1fb6865ef591678d

Directory /var/lib/vhost_sockets will be used to create vhost sockets

commit_message:
Apply the vhost group parameter for the vhost_sockets directory creation

Directory /var/lib/vhost_sockets will be used to create vhost sockets
which should have the the group name as hugetlbfs, which is common
between qemu and openvswitch to share the vhost_sockets. And the
correct selinux context to be applied on the vhost_sockets directory.
Closes-Bug: #1751711
Change-Id: Ib917cf86bd9a4ce57af243ab43337ea6c88bf76c

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iee4a31b43f1f60410892e25d4e33ce63a620a95b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Default NodeTLSData to always attempt setting TLS cert

This is part of enabling TLS by default. It'll be needed in order to get
the certificate injection to work.

Needed-By: I3d3cad0eb1396e7bee146794b29badad302efdf3
Change-Id: I25e35ad1e4f12eb4cca7a0cd3e120e70e4a8c564

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 05:37:30.000000000', 'message': 'Set ulimit for neutron agent containers

Neutron agents are using oslo-rootwrap-daemon to run
privileged commands. Containers inherit file descriptor
limit from docker daemon(currently:1048576) which is too
high and leading to performance issues. This patch set
nofile limit for neutron agent containers to 1024 which is
reasonable as before containers they were using host defaults
i.e 1024.

Depends-On: I0cfcf4e3e3e13578ec42e12f459732992fb3a760
Change-Id: Iec722cdfd7642ff3149f50d940d8079b9e1b7147
Related-Bug: #1760471
'}]
commit_message:
Set ulimit for neutron agent containers

Neutron agents are using oslo-rootwrap-daemon to run
privileged commands. Containers inherit file descriptor
limit from docker daemon(currently:1048576) which is too
high and leading to performance issues. This patch set
nofile limit for neutron agent containers to 1024 which is
reasonable as before containers they were using host defaults
i.e 1024.

Depends-On: I0cfcf4e3e3e13578ec42e12f459732992fb3a760
Change-Id: Iec722cdfd7642ff3149f50d940d8079b9e1b7147
Related-Bug: #1760471

commit_message:
Customizing the availability zone of each compute node is Ineffective

Cloud administrators can customize the availability zone of
each compute node by setting the following in the config file:

  [DEFAULT]
  default_availability_zone = my-zone

When use "zun service-list", the availability-zone is always
nova no matter what we set default_availability_zone to

Change-Id: I3f1c8edd68ea089b7b40c30fac92d7dbbdf4fa59
Closes-Bug: #1762149

commit_message:
Make datetime strings consistent for future parsing

Lets set a default timestamp format for any datetime
strings we know we need to parse later. While we can always
parse the direct output of what we have now, lets control it
so we always have a valid format as expected.

Change-Id: I4af359ea30ace9361c9c5d21e91a0528076eb892

commit_message:
Fix type_name for profile

Senlin API uses type_name for type, but dashboard does not
process type_name. So this issue causes error to handle
Profile object.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I4d2453e402bbb4d294c45f38d0c8be3202f53f53

commit_message:
Clean up diskimages for debian-(jessie|stretch)

Ensure both amd64/arm64 DIBs for nodepool are using the same settings.

Also adds missing label for debien-stretch on nl01.o.o.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 23:56:04.000000000', 'message': "(WIP)DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not been retreived from the keepalived
instance and only retrieved from the centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retreive it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retreiving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450
"}, {'created': '2018-03-26 22:19:46.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not been retreived from the keepalived
instance and only retrieved from the centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retreive it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retreiving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450
"}, {'created': '2018-03-29 15:41:23.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not

commit_message:
DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not being retrieved from the
keepalived instance and only retrieved from the
centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retrieve it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retrieving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450

commit_message:
Default CertmongerUser to be defined for undercloud setup

In instack-undercloud we're defaulting the certmonger_user puppet setup
to be always included [1]. This is because we want it to setup the local
CA, even if it doesn't set up any certificates. We want the same for the
containerized undercloud.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558768

Change-Id: I4ec27755de82b9ced9144c27089eba33b36cb17f

commit_message:
Add ability to set protocol in endpoint_data.yaml file

Currently we can noly set the port and suffixes for each endpoint, this
enables the script to be able to generate the protocol in the endpoint
map.

Change-Id: I890e1022459beea9f3d0a0e333fbed0ac063f96b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-05 19:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add __repr__ for NovaException

Due to change c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8 in
oslo.serialization, serialized exceptions in errors no longer
have kwargs. This change fixes the problem by adding __repr__
to NovaException which will return a string representation
of exception.__dict__. This string contains the exception message
along with all the kwargs. Without __repr__, the serialization
process for exceptions just returns the exception type and the
default message, without the kwargs.

Change-Id: I653282a030d03362dfca0fd1026cebe920d54e37
Closes-Bug: #1756360
(cherry picked from commit cc457dfffad7c4980e6f36364bdf190c79cf23e1)
'}]
commit_message:
Add __repr__ for NovaException

Due to change c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8 in
oslo.serialization, serialized exceptions in errors no longer
have kwargs. This change fixes the problem by adding __repr__
to NovaException which will return a string representation
of exception.__dict__. This string contains the exception message
along with all the kwargs. Without __repr__, the serialization
process for exceptions just returns the exception type and the
default message, without the kwargs.

Change-Id: I653282a030d03362dfca0fd1026cebe920d54e37
Closes-Bug: #1756360
(cherry picked from commit cc457dfffad7c4980e6f36364bdf190c79cf23e1)

commit_message:
Add new config option and setup for token keys

This change adds new configuration options under the `token`
section for key_repository and max_active_keys. These settings
are meant to replace the settings of the same name under
the `fernet_tokens` catagory, which this change also deprecates.

Also added token_setup and token_rotate that uses the same
functionality as fernet_setup and fernet_rotate. These are
to move users to a generic usage.

Change-Id: Idca9b8ccbc2220bf2039d7c4e2ee8b2bb5d70313

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It may cause fail in
requirements-check.

REF:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Ib837a7f8d257f116845d483cd63bf362f10725d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 11:21:10.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the InternalTLSVncCAFile to comply with selinux policy

InternalTLSVncCAFile currently defaults to /etc/ipa/vnc.crt.
Certmonger attempts to save the CA cert to this path as cert_t, however
/etc/ipa is etc_t.
Moving to /etc/pki/CA/certs which is cert_t resolves the issue, and is
arugably a more suitable location.

Change-Id: Ib275fc43dd772851511598a4932c19fcda706479
(cherry picked from commit ab78b1fcc167ab2452aeabc4535a44f7ad0145c0)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the InternalTLSVncCAFile to comply with selinux policy

InternalTLSVncCAFile currently defaults to /etc/ipa/vnc.crt.
Certmonger attempts to save the CA cert to this path as cert_t, however
/etc/ipa is etc_t.
Moving to /etc/pki/CA/certs which is cert_t resolves the issue, and is
arugably a more suitable location.

Change-Id: Ib275fc43dd772851511598a4932c19fcda706479
(cherry picked from commit ab78b1fcc167ab2452aeabc4535a44f7ad0145c0)

commit_message:
Fix a typo in libvirt driver

A typo in libvirt driver made impossible to make a patch request to
/redfish/v1/Systems/<identity>.

Change-Id: I43e4324d099862dec68951066300d24f3b2adb9d
Closes-Bug: #1758073

commit_message:
Add max microversion = 2.42 for compute host tests

This is to add max_microversion = 2.42 for compute host tests
as the API in question is deprecated from 2.43 onward [0].
This is also consistent with Tempest [1].

Also adds a test for test_show_host to be consistent with [1] but
not any other endpoints as those are too risky to run Patrole side or have
various warnings associated with them in the API documentation [0].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#hosts-os-hosts-deprecated
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/28b252f7f61a2dfc585089265cdb3118defbcfff/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hosts.py#L23

Partially Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Ifceb5d4656a76bf865f8ef494fc1b093b626cfe0

commit_message:
Set max microversion for some hypervisor tests to 2.52

The following tests:

  * test_list_servers_on_hypervisor [0]
  * test_search_hypervisor [1]

are deprecated from 2.53 onward. So this is to add max_microversion = 2.52
for these tests. This is also consistent with Tempest [2].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-hypervisor-servers
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#search-hypervisor
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/28b252f7f61a2dfc585089265cdb3118defbcfff/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor.py#L108

Partially Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Iec782e680e2b3429db325d7b575c3b3b5eb4a8c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-05 06:04:32.000000000', 'message': 'Increase RBAC test coverage for floating ips bulk API

This PS adds better RBAC test coverage for Nova
os-floating-ip-pools API, the documentation for which is here: [0].
The same policy is enforced for each endpoint: [1]. The
max_microversion is 2.35 since the API is deprecated in 2.36
onward [2]. Only [3] is not tested because there is no
corresponding Tempest endpoint in its client.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#floating-ips-bulk-os-floating-ips-bulk-deprecated
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/policies/floating_ips_bulk.py

commit_message:
Increase RBAC test coverage for floating ips bulk API

This PS adds better RBAC test coverage for Nova
os-floating-ip-pools API, the documentation for which is here: [0].
The same policy is enforced for each endpoint: [1]. The
max_microversion is 2.35 since the API is deprecated in 2.36
onward [2]. Only [3] is not tested because there is no
corresponding Tempest endpoint in its client.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#floating-ips-bulk-os-floating-ips-bulk-deprecated
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/policies/floating_ips_bulk.py
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-floating-ips
[3] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-floating-ips-by-host

Change-Id: Ie28ee0b4e76e59b9813bf352f03c0cf14fa91616

commit_message:
rehome qos bw limit direction api def

This patch rehomes the qos bandwidth limit direction extension's API
definition into neutron-lib. This definition extends an existing
sub-resource and thus requires the unit test changes in commit
Ib91004490dc3ca71b7caafe5cc3cb07417be1e4c

For sample consumption see commit
I4cea734dd713f00d6e4c416a50c4dde620dc644d

Change-Id: I823f567ddf9c895eb3cf94e95ae34a382d67f51d

commit_message:
Use the right hypervisor name for ovh hosts

We set the hypervisor name to 'qemu' instead of qemu, so the
templated fact is "'qemu'", which is an incorrect hypervisor name.

Change-Id: Ib07a93db1d0f826701fd58f95243eb17ef017e4b
(cherry picked from commit 62c2b18f3f3b4caecced5b89f80e20dfcd9e2137)

subject: Remove EXPANDING state
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 21:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-04 11:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-06 17:28:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-07 09:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-09 19:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nlove it!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove EXPANDING state

The shard range EXPANDING state was introduced in [1] as a means of
preventing an acceptor shard range treating updates from its donor as
misplaced objects during shrinking. The state was needed because the
acceptor namespace was not expanded prior to shrinking starting, so
the donor's objects would appear to be misplaced in the acceptor.

Now that the proxy controller is able to cope with overlapping shard
ranges when building concatenated shard listings, it is possible for
the acceptor namespace to be expanded prior to shrinking and for the
acceptor to temporarily overlap the donor in the root container. This
makes the EXPANDING state unnecessary.

[1] Related-Change: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b
Change-Id: I47e4ee2123f617d6eb7fdfdce94d8de877a42e5c
"}, {'created': '2018-04-02 21:57:13.000000000', 'message': "Remove EXPANDING state

The shard range EXPANDING state was introduced in [1] as a means of
preventing an acceptor shard range treating updates from its donor as
misplaced objects during shrinking. The state was needed because the
acceptor namespace was not expanded prior to shrinking starting, so
the donor's objects would appear to be misplaced in the acceptor.

Now that the proxy controller is able to cope with overlapping shard
ranges when building concatenated shard listings, it is possible for
the acceptor namespace to be expanded prior to shrinking and for the
acceptor to temporarily overlap the donor in the root container. This
makes the EXPANDING state unnecessary.

[1] Related-Change: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b
Change-Id: I47e4ee2123f617d6eb7fdfdce94d8de877a42e5c
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 11:43:29.000000000', 'message': "Remove EXPANDING state

The shard range EXPANDING state was introduced in [1] as a means of
preventing an acceptor shard range treating updates from its donor as
misplaced objects during shrinking. The state was needed because the
acceptor namespace was not expanded prior to shrinking starting, so
the donor's objects would appear to be misplaced in the acceptor.

Now that the proxy controller is able to cope with overlapping shard
ranges when building concatenated shard listings, it is possible for
the acceptor namespace to be expanded prior to shrinking and for the
acceptor to temporarily overlap the donor in the root container. This
makes the EXPANDING state unnecessary.

There is no longer any need for the special case that excluded other
shard ranges from updates to root while shrinking since the root now
already knows about the acceptor's expanded namespace.

[1] Related-Change: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b
Change-Id: I47e4ee2123f617d6eb7fdfdce94d8de877a42e5c
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 12:41:57.000000000', 'message': "Remove EXPANDING state

commit_message:
Remove EXPANDING state

The shard range EXPANDING state was introduced in [1] as a means of
preventing an acceptor shard range treating updates from its donor as
misplaced objects during shrinking. The state was needed because the
acceptor namespace was not expanded prior to shrinking starting, so
the donor's objects would appear to be misplaced in the acceptor.

Now that the proxy controller is able to cope with overlapping shard
ranges when building concatenated shard listings, it is possible for
the acceptor namespace to be expanded prior to shrinking and for the
acceptor to temporarily overlap the donor in the root container. This
makes the EXPANDING state unnecessary.

There is no longer any need for the special case that excluded other
shard ranges from updates to root while shrinking since the root now
already knows about the acceptor's expanded namespace.

[1] Related-Change: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b
Change-Id: I47e4ee2123f617d6eb7fdfdce94d8de877a42e5c

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Neutron-dynamic-routing
delegates making this call to oslo.service.
This was provided in patchset
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e

Further patches will be needed to make select config options be
marked as mutable. This change enables support for oslo provided

Task: 12505

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Neutron-dynamic-routing

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Neutron-dynamic-routing
delegates making this call to oslo.service.
This was provided in patchset
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e

Further patches will be needed to make select config options be
marked as mutable. This change enables support for oslo provided
config options to be updated via SIGHUP such as log level.

Change-Id: Icb405ae7197af7507469593e8555b833186c0e68
Task: 12505
Story: 2001545

the problem is I don't know if its a legitimate test with this changeset (I suspect not, as this is just supposed to fix the missing Nova policies)'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-04-03 22:48:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I should've read the comments on the original commit, I see that the non-existing policy results changed (and caused the original commit to need a patchset 6), so I'm guessing this was done in queens:
Akihiro Motoki

This fails after the policy behavior for non-existing rule was fixed."}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-04-03 22:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-03 23:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

This is an incompatible change so it violates the stable backport policy that all backports must be compatible. In addition, a bug is required.'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-04-04 16:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(5 comments)

WF-1 while I consider the appropriate approach here. Anyone using a generated nova_policy.json file will need some form of fix for the missing policy rules, and the changeset I attempted to cherry-pick here was how that was addressed in queens, so backporting it seemed like the correct approach. Based on the feedback here, it may not be the best approach. The missing rules do cause issues, but they will only be noticed by users who are not using the checked-in copy of nova_policy.json because its a mismatch for the actual nova policy rules...'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-04-04 16:35:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I see where openstack_auth/policy.py  was updated in Queens to include reading the POLICY_DIRS configuration, now I'm really confused how my test env with just the settings change resolved the issue I was seeing... will dig around more"}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-04-04 17:14:45.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

changeset only appeared to be working in pike, but was just a happy path of a race condition. lack of POLICY_DIR support means this won't work"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-09 20:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Hi Jeremy,

I think we can discuss POLICY_DIRS is backport-able or not.

On the other hand, we should keep the backward-compatibility of the past releases of Pike. At least the policy rule in api_access/tables.py needs to be kept as someone already use it. This is the main reason of my -1.

"default" rule actually does not affect the nova related behavior from my experience of the policy-update patch series in Queens.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 18:45:12.000000000', 'message': 'Sync nova policy

Based on nova commit 32c8ac6b7dfe4ca0c211cbce7c5a67d88558126f

The new file was generated by oslopolicy-sample-generator:
  oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace nova --format json

nova uses policy-in-code now, so there is a lot of differences.
Sorted version diff is http://paste.openstack.org/show/628742/

All policies with "@" have been dropped.
Dropped policies used in horizon are:
  os_compute_api:os-certificates:create
  os_compute_api:os-scheduler-hints:discoverable
  os_compute_api:os-server-groups:discoverable

[discoverable]
"discoverable" policies are related to nova API extensions
but the API extension mechanism has gone in Nova Queens,
so these policies now make no sense in Nova.
In Horizon side, we are still use a bit older API version
to launch instance, so it seems some fallback policies are needed
and they are added as conf/nova_policy.d.

[os_compute_api:os-certificates:create]
No corresponding policy is found, so the related policy check is dropped.
EC2 API is provided as a separate project from nova.
I guess this is the reason the policy was dropped.
DownloadEC2 action referred to it, but we already checks EC2 service
is available so I believe the policy can be dropped safely.

[openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.rest.test_policy]
Unit tests are updated according to the nova policy change.
Note that test_rule_alone previously succeeded because it used
non-existing policy and fallbacked to 'default' rule.
The rule is changed to a policy for non-admin user.

Change-Id: I68f91bc29b20a4ecd613fc75735d38b9a48162ee

commit_message:
Sync nova policy

Based on nova commit 32c8ac6b7dfe4ca0c211cbce7c5a67d88558126f

The new file was generated by oslopolicy-sample-generator:
  oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace nova --format json

nova uses policy-in-code now, so there is a lot of differences.
Sorted version diff is http://paste.openstack.org/show/628742/

All policies with "@" have been dropped.
Dropped policies used in horizon are:
  os_compute_api:os-certificates:create
  os_compute_api:os-scheduler-hints:discoverable
  os_compute_api:os-server-groups:discoverable

[discoverable]
"discoverable" policies are related to nova API extensions
but the API extension mechanism has gone in Nova Queens,
so these policies now make no sense in Nova.
In Horizon side, we are still use a bit older API version
to launch instance, so it seems some fallback policies are needed
and they are added as conf/nova_policy.d.

[os_compute_api:os-certificates:create]
No corresponding policy is found, so the related policy check is dropped.
EC2 API is provided as a separate project from nova.
I guess this is the reason the policy was dropped.
DownloadEC2 action referred to it, but we already checks EC2 service
is available so I believe the policy can be dropped safely.

[openstack_dashboard.test.unit.api.rest.test_policy]
Unit tests are updated according to the nova policy change.
Note that test_rule_alone previously succeeded because it used
non-existing policy and fallbacked to 'default' rule.
The rule is changed to a policy for non-admin user.

Change-Id: I68f91bc29b20a4ecd613fc75735d38b9a48162ee

Also, can you link the client and dashboard patches or stories to add these timeouts?'}, {'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-03-29 09:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

The API documentation is confusing with not explaining the difference between -optional and not. Also we should explain what we mean with content inspection - not everybody id familiar with it (and know he should look in the haproxy docs).

Furthermore are those the only time-out parameters which make sense? Maybe F5 has some others and they mean something else? A spec might be useful to determine that -- just saying.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-04-02 23:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Ok, disregard my optional comments -- this api-ref stuff is still confusing me'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-03 18:01:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

@xgerman Yes, there could be other settings (the story linked in the commit lists a few more) but none of them are really that commonly used, and could be added in a followup. I talked to the original story author (Kevin Fox) and I believe the ones we're adding here will be sufficient for his needs (and the needs of the people internally that were asking me about it, as well).
These are already named differently from their HAProxy counterparts, so it should be impossible to argue that we are exposing implementation details there, and I would say these are very common options, not at all specific to HAProxy anyway."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-04-04 00:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Ok, this looks good, but I think we do need some discussion of the timeouts and what they mean in the text of the API-REF.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-04 04:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-04 04:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-04-04 17:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:13:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

The more I looked at this in the api-ref and what we already have for the descriptions it seems pretty clear what those timeouts are for. I think this is good and we don't need to add more commentary that would just copy the parameter descriptions."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Only thing I am thinking is not to have individual columns per timeout but instead like just json or something, then if u need further timeouts u don't have to do database things. But idk if openstack recommends a mysql with (native) json abilities yet, lol."}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

like to see someone who deals more with users comment on the descriptions... after all my users are still confused what "ERROR" means and we do a better job explaining that ;-)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:31:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@jxharlow We do the JSON Blob thing elsewhere for some semi-structured user data (header insertion values) and I think the consensus is that it's not a good way to go about things. I feel like in general, blob storage in SQL is not recommended for a variety of reasons. Is my thinking outdated?"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-04-04 20:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Unsure myself, though these especially feel like configs that are sorta just going to be extracted and not indexed or searched on or such.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-05 23:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Well, *I* have users requesting these things, and they know what they are. :P'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-04-09 19:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Expose timeout options

Various timeout options need to be exposed to enable use-cases more
complex than standard HTTP requests.

In this patch we expose four new timeout values:
* timeout_client_data
* timeout_member_connect
* timeout_member_data
* timeout_tcp_inspect

Change-Id: Id4667201c1bfaa06f7af9060c936ba00c2f314f9
Story: 1457556
Task: 5453

TrivialFix

commit_message:
tests: fixed NoSuchGroupError in TestNovaSegmentNotifier

The tests are failing when executed separately with -m testtools.run
because they rely on another test class to register ml2 and ml2_vlan
option sections.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7a9a5c7c7f62783aceccd9e6ea62aacd9753d0d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-07 17:21:15.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh router objects after port binding

Post-binding information about router ports is missing in results of RPC
calls made by l3 agents. sync_routers code ensures that bindings are
present, however, it does not refresh router objects before returning
them - for RPC clients ports remain unbound before the next sync and
there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes
from fip namespaces to qrouter namespaces.

 Conflicts:
	neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
(cherry picked from commit 1ce070c8e2edcdd58b2c032c3223bde318ec1ee9)
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh router objects after port binding

Post-binding information about router ports is missing in results of RPC
calls made by l3 agents. sync_routers code ensures that bindings are
present, however, it does not refresh router objects before returning
them - for RPC clients ports remain unbound before the next sync and
there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes
from fip namespaces to qrouter namespaces.

 Conflicts:
	neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971
(cherry picked from commit 1ce070c8e2edcdd58b2c032c3223bde318ec1ee9)

that event tags didn't have dashes in them, but they all
do since they are either port or volume IDs, which are UUIDs.

This adds a parse_key function to split the event name on

"}, {'created': '2018-04-01 14:00:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix cancel_all_events event name parsing

that event tags didn't have dashes in them, but they all
do since they are either port or volume IDs, which are UUIDs.

Change-Id: I15f041e820c2dabe82e8e25bf77f9cc86330a76a

"}, {'created': '2018-04-02 18:08:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix cancel_all_events event name parsing

The cancel_all_events function was incorrectly assuming
that event tags didn't have dashes in them, but they all
do since they are either port or volume IDs, which are UUIDs.

Instead of just storing our event data indexed by the composite
event key, we should just store the name and tag distinctly so
that there is no question about now to dissect the two from the
key later. This is all internal record-keeping inside of the
compute manager, so we can change it to whatever we want.

This includes a slight change to the internal virtapi interface
for wait_for_instance_event(), which removes the ability to
pass composite event keys as strings instead of (name, tag)
tuples. In reality, none of the virt code was using the key string
format, so this just cleans up a few tests that were. It makes
that interface less ambiguous, which is good anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1760303

commit_message:
Fix cancel_all_events event name parsing

The cancel_all_events function was incorrectly assuming
that event tags didn't have dashes in them, but they all
do since they are either port or volume IDs, which are UUIDs.

Instead of just storing our event data indexed by the composite
event key, we should just store the name and tag distinctly so
that there is no question about how to dissect the two from the
key later. This is all internal record-keeping inside of the
compute manager, so we can change it to whatever we want.

This includes a slight change to the internal virtapi interface
for wait_for_instance_event(), which removes the ability to
pass composite event keys as strings instead of (name, tag)
tuples. In reality, none of the virt code was using the key string
format, so this just cleans up a few tests that were. It makes
that interface less ambiguous, which is good anyway.

Change-Id: I15f041e820c2dabe82e8e25bf77f9cc86330a76a
Closes-Bug: #1760303

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot

The ONTAP driver was ignoring the size requested when
creating a share from an existing snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1717263
Change-Id: I335f72a8dea49d5855201fc63a7ac22240b60bbf
(cherry picked from commit 0531a1a9ef8aa829a355d4dd7b188681e726ff68)

the baremetal-undercloud role, fixing also its structure, and updating
some sentences related to the usage.

commit_message:
Add passwords and images for separate messaging backends

Introduce separate RPC and Notify user/passwords for distinct
messaging transports. Also make both the following services
point to the same DockerRabbitmq* imagename by default:
OS::TripleO::Services::OsloMessagingRpc
OS::TripleO::Services::OsloMessagingNotify

Needed-By: I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0
Change-Id: I03e99d35ed043cf11bea9b7462058bd80f4d99da

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-08 15:47:16.000000000', 'message': 'Install correctly openstack-backports-archive-keyring

Currently, this puppet module uses this command for installing the Debian
archive keyring:

  apt-get install -y openstack-backports-archive-keyring

It is in fact missing the --allow-unauthenticated option, which is
necessary since the package is not authenticated before it is installed.
Therefore, the command fails and ./all-in-one.sh just stops.

Change-Id: I396eefa6408656a36c8debb13bbab608b52e0d68
'}]
commit_message:
Install correctly openstack-backports-archive-keyring

Currently, this puppet module uses this command for installing the Debian
archive keyring:

  apt-get install -y openstack-backports-archive-keyring

It is in fact missing the --allow-unauthenticated option, which is
necessary since the package is not authenticated before it is installed.
Therefore, the command fails and ./all-in-one.sh just stops.

Change-Id: I396eefa6408656a36c8debb13bbab608b52e0d68

commit_message:
vars: suse: Use correct package for python Ceph bindings

The package that provides the required bindings is 'python-ceph' instead
of 'python-cephfs'

Change-Id: Ie811daa5596a65b260ead5d4c72b9f49fcaede13

[{'account_id': 27275, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Disallow unmanage for encrypted volumes

*disallow unmanaging an encrypted volume
*display error message "Invalid volume:Un-managing an
 encrypted volume is not permitted"

Related-Bug : https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1731518

Change-Id: I0374e33104d92d782adebeb6415532425e230c92

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: IPVPN MPLS OVS driver, silently ignore re-removal

The dataplane drivers should silently ignore removing state
for a route that had already been removed, but the IPVPN MPLS
OVS driver was not doing that.

(No UC because complete overhaul of the driver is in progress)

Change-Id: I6d7d93265748c55cd68b89acde32016deed1428f

commit_message:
Use the right hypervisor name for ovh hosts

We set the hypervisor name to 'qemu' instead of qemu, so the
templated fact is "'qemu'", which is an incorrect hypervisor name.

Change-Id: Ib07a93db1d0f826701fd58f95243eb17ef017e4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 19:34:16.000000000', 'message': 'Handle migrating encryption key IDs in Backup table

Enhance the code that migrates the ConfKeyManager's fixed_key to
Barbican to also consider the Backup table. When the original key
migration feature was added, the encryption key ID was not stored in
the Backup table. But now the Backup table contains that field, so
the migration code needs to handle that table as well.

Whereas the cinder-volume service is responsible for migrating keys
in the Volume and Snapshot tables, the cinder-backup service handles
migrating keys in the Backup table. Each instance of the service
migrates its own entries by matching the "host" field in the
corresponding tables.

The Backup OVO now inherits from base.CinderComparableObject. This does
not affect the object's hash signature, and so the version number does
need to be incremented.

Closes-Bug: #1757235
Change-Id: Id4581eec80f82925c20c424847bff1baceda2349
(cherry picked from commit 341dd44ba796e933920da6718a2891e35ed88506)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle migrating encryption key IDs in Backup table

Enhance the code that migrates the ConfKeyManager's fixed_key to
Barbican to also consider the Backup table. When the original key
migration feature was added, the encryption key ID was not stored in
the Backup table. But now the Backup table contains that field, so
the migration code needs to handle that table as well.

Whereas the cinder-volume service is responsible for migrating keys
in the Volume and Snapshot tables, the cinder-backup service handles
migrating keys in the Backup table. Each instance of the service
migrates its own entries by matching the "host" field in the
corresponding tables.

The Backup OVO now inherits from base.CinderComparableObject. This does
not affect the object's hash signature, and so the version number does
need to be incremented.

Closes-Bug: #1757235
Change-Id: Id4581eec80f82925c20c424847bff1baceda2349
(cherry picked from commit 341dd44ba796e933920da6718a2891e35ed88506)

Doug, can you explain why this doesn't match the lower-constraints in requirements?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:38:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Doug, can you explain why this doesn't match the lower-constraints
 > in requirements?

My guess is that because we delayed turning of the bot job that proposes g-r updates one of those patches updated some requirements files. That job never updated the lower-constraints.txt list because (a) it wouldn't have existed and (b) we were going to turn it off anyway."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 22:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-04 01:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-05 13:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-05 16:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-05 18:34:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I don't know if this matters, but there seems to be something strange here.  qpid-python, that Sean added on PS10, is listed in test-req.txt, but doesn't show up when I create the l-c tox environment and then use its pip to do 'pip freeze' as described in Doug's email.  Also, my pip freeze output doesn't include pika or pika-pool, which are in the l-c.txt on this patch."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-05 19:14:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> I don't know if this matters, but there seems to be something
 > strange here.  qpid-python, that Sean added on PS10, is listed in
 > test-req.txt, but doesn't show up when I create the l-c tox
 > environment and then use its pip to do 'pip freeze' as described in
 > Doug's email.  Also, my pip freeze output doesn't include pika or
 > pika-pool, which are in the l-c.txt on this patch.

All of those things are optional dependencies of oslo.messaging, only needed when specific drivers are used. I'm not sure why qpid-python isn't included here automatically. Do you want to add it? Is it used by the unit tests?"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-05 23:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I just realized that since the l-c uses basepython of python3 and the line in test-req.txt for qpid is:

qpid-python>=0.26;python_version=='2.7' 

it wouldn't get pulled in by pip.  On a related note, I removed it from test-req.txt and the py27 unit and functional tests still pass.  I'm going to put up a DNM patch without qpid to see what happens, there may be some cruft in my environment."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-05 23:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Patch of current master without qpid-python in test-req.txt is https://review.openstack.org/559194'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

@Doug: from https://review.openstack.org/559194 , looks like we don't need qpid in test-requirements.txt.  Is your advice to not include it, or to leave it in "just in case"?'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-06 01:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

That's really odd. If you go back and look at patchset 10, the failure there was that qpid-python was missing. If that was just a red herring, and it was actually whatever that was that appears to have been fixed indirectly with the matching u"" failure message, then I agree we should just remove that package.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-06 05:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> @Doug: from https://review.openstack.org/559194 , looks like we
 > don't need qpid in test-requirements.txt.  Is your advice to not
 > include it, or to leave it in "just in case"?

If the unit tests don't import and use it, and you don't have a functional test job configured to use it, you shouldn't need it. And if you do have either of those things, you should be getting the version that oslo.messaging specifies as *its* dependency. So I would remove it from the file.'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-04-06 06:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-06 08:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-06 16:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:06:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

I think Sean is correct that as long as qpid is in test-req.txt, the l-c job will fail if we remove it from l-c.txt in this patch.  I think let's approve this to get it moving, and then we can follow up with a patch to remove qpid from test-req.txt and l-c.txt"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

I think that's a good plan Brian. Will leave it to you to approve since I made some modifications in this patch."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

LGTM, Thanks for sorting this out guys!'}]

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ibd41a407f8f5f4eb2de1a44904fb7df5ab81e30c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

Dropped the following, for reasons
pecan: neutron working on fixing their pecan usage fail
pbr: open review
pika: incompat
sphinx: failing doc builds
oslo.config: open review
botocore: they capped python-dateutil
pyldap: don't like the new formatting

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558217
Change-Id: I3d5e89a201339ca6ee0d92509a3b1eb4a9bc2d31
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 15:20:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix intermittent v2 shell unit test failures

The do_image_download code has a check to make sure that there's
a place to put the data (either filename or stdout redirect) before
initiating the download.  The location of this check was moved by
change I841bebeda38814235079429eca0b1e5fd2f04dae to happen at the
beginning of the function.  The two intermittently failing tests
do not explicitly address the check condition, and as a result the
tests do exit early, but before they can check what they're supposed
to be testing.

Closes-bug: #1759951

Change-Id: I3c85bb358f669504b364d55618c21382b7a2a66b
(cherry picked from commit dc3ee4aedbd9023bba1581a987b517f00b9bfd0e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix intermittent v2 shell unit test failures

The do_image_download code has a check to make sure that there's
a place to put the data (either filename or stdout redirect) before
initiating the download.  The location of this check was moved by
change I841bebeda38814235079429eca0b1e5fd2f04dae to happen at the
beginning of the function.  The two intermittently failing tests
do not explicitly address the check condition, and as a result the
tests do exit early, but before they can check what they're supposed
to be testing.

Closes-bug: #1759951

Change-Id: I3c85bb358f669504b364d55618c21382b7a2a66b
(cherry picked from commit dc3ee4aedbd9023bba1581a987b517f00b9bfd0e)

commit_message:
Fix Angular errors in openstack_auth

Angular errors on login page are caused by loading ngdetails view.
Although registration of URL for ngdetails is executed on top level
of Horizon, ngdetails view is not needed to be loaded in login page,
i.e. openstack_auth side.
To fix this issue, this patch moves registration of URL for ngdetails
into openstack_dashboard side.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/test/urls.py
	openstack_dashboard/urls.py

The above conflicts are caused by bp/django2-support which landed in Rocky,
particully by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527323/12.

Change-Id: Ib039417b4e666c2341f17ac05fd7723bc758816c
Closes-Bug: #1754133
Closes-Bug: #1753557
(cherry picked from commit f494c6f2d475bfc936b78fda7ce11ed4d46c7224)

commit_message:
Don't ensure pki permissions for releases <= Pike

Openstack PKI token support was dropped in the Pike release.
The following update ensures that PKI token validation is
only run if the release is supported when the sync leader
broadcasts any service credentials to its peers.

In this case; if the release is <= pike. then we can sync
token certs and ensure the pki permissions are valid.
Otherwise this action will be skipped.

Closes-Bug: 1759403
Change-Id: I3d8ba6d3cac3a3505a3722a5082c3a6933a9ef67
